chapter.title: Moderation Options
chapter.para: &FUDforum; has a number of tools that are available to moderators and administrators in regard to managing users and messages, this section covers those tools and gives tips on how to use them to their maximum potential.

note.simpara: When referring to 'privileged users', this section refers to users who are moderators, administrators and to the users who have been granted permission pertaining to a certain ability using the groups permissions system if a relevant permission is available.

sect1.title: Custom Avatar Queue
sect1.para: This link will only be visible to the forum's administrator(s) should there be any custom avatars pending approval. Beside the link there will be a red number indicating the number of avatars that are pending administrative approval. Clicking on the link would take the administrator to the avatar approval form allowing them to approve or decline the avatar.

If the avatar is approved or declined, the user who had requested this avatar will be notified via a private message if private messaging system is enabled or via e-mail about the status of their avatar.

sect1.title: Moderation Queue
sect1.para:
This link will be visible if there are any messages pending approval in moderated forums. Beside the link there would be a red indicator showing the number of messages awaiting approval. Clicking on the link would take the moderator to a control panel where they would be able to see all of the messages that are pending approval and either approve or delete those messages by using 'Approve' and 'Delete' links found on that page.
This option is ONLY be visible to the administrator(s) and forum moderators who moderate the forums that have unapproved messages in them.

sect1.title: Reported Messages
sect1.para: This link will be visible if there are any reported messages. Reported messages are messages that a forum user has chosen to report to the forum administration for whatever reason, as part of the report form the user will be required to enter a reason for the message report so that the administration staff knows why this report was made.

Clicking on the reported messages link will take the moderator to a special page where the moderator can review the reported message as well as reason for the report. From that page the moderator may choose to delete the report and/or take some action in response to the report.

sect1.title: Move Thread
sect1.para: This option which is visible to all privileged users beside each thread on the thread view (thread.php) allows them to move the thread to a different forum. Clicking on the link will open a pop-up window with a list of all the available forums.
If the user in question has permission to move the thread to the destination forum then the thread will be moved to their forum of choice once they click on that forum.

Otherwise beside the forum there will be a 'request a move' link. Clicking on this link will allow the moderator to request that the thread be moved to another forum, the form will allow the moderator to enter their reasoning behind their request. It will then be up to the administrator(s) or the moderator(s) of the destination forum to approve or decline the request via the Thread Exchange.

sect1.title: Thread Exchange
sect1.para: This link will be visible if there are any move thread requests pending as well as indicate how many of those requests are pending. Clicking on the link would take the moderator to a page where they'll be able to see the move request and either accept or decline the move thread request made by another moderator.

sect2.title: Deleting a thread
sect2.para: Deletion of a thread is an action, which can be performed by privileged users by clicking on the delete link beside each thread on the thread listing, or by clicking on the delete button of the root (1st message in the thread) message.

sect2.title: Deleting a message
sect2.para: Privileged users can delete a message by clicking on the delete button located at the bottom of each message, that is located in a forum where they have delete privileges.

sect1.title: Edit Message
sect1.para:
Privileged users can edit the content as well as the subject of the message posted in forums in which they have edit privileges.
Unless the Show Edited By Moderator is set to no, messages edited by privileged users will be marked as such.

sect1.title: Split Thread
sect1.para: Split thread link, which is visible to privileged users when they are viewing the content of the thread allows for splitting of a thread in to two separate threads. This is mostly done to allow the forum staff to move off topic discussions that have wondered in to a relevant thread.
When clicked, the link would take the privileged user to a control form where how the thread will be split can be specified.

At the top of this form there is a textbox where the name of the new thread will be specified as well as a drop down box with a list of forums where the new thread will be placed. Below these controls there are two buttons allowing the privileged user to split the selected or the non-selected messages.
All the messages in the thread are listed on the 'Split Thread Control Panel', the messages can be selected by marking the checkbox, which is located to left of every message.

Clicking on the 'Split selected messages' button would then split all the selected messages or if the 'Split non-selected messages' button is clicked then all the non-selected messages will be moved to a new thread.

sect1.title: Thread Locking/Unlocking
sect1.para: Privileged users may lock and unlock threads using a link available on the thread contents page. Locked threads prevent regular users from being able to post replies in the thread.
When privileged users post new threads or replies to existing threads they may lock thread by marking the 'Thread Locked' checkbox. The thread will be automatically locked once the post is made.

sect1.title: Sticky/Announcements
sect1.para: Privileged users may create threads and mark them as 'Sticky' or 'Announcements'. Such threads will be displayed at the top of thread listing regardless of their age until they reach their expiration date as defined by the privileged user.
This functionality is available on the post form to all privileged users.

sect1.title: Display of Message Author IP Address
sect1.para: All moderators and administrators will be able to see the IP address of message authors. Clicking on the IP address will open a page, which will show the information about that user's ISP.

sect1.title: User Group Management
sect1.para: This control panel allows the administrator(s) and group leader(s) to add and remove users from the various groups as well as alter the permissions of those users.
If the user can manage more then one group then a list of all the groups that they can manage will be shown allowing them to choose a group to edit.

The form also includes a control allowing for addition/editing of users in the group as well as specifying their permissions, the editable permissions contain drop downs with 'Yes/No' toggles allowing the group manager to grant or take away the permission from the user.
Below is the explanation of the permissions that can be granted or removed using the groups system.

sect2.title: Visible
sect2.para: Allows the user to see the forum on the forum listing on the front page.

sect2.title: Read
sect2.para: Allows the user to read the messages inside the forum.

sect2.title: Post
sect2.para: The ability to create new threads in the forum.

sect2.title: Reply
sect2.para: The ability to post replies to existing threads in the forum.

sect2.title: Edit
sect2.para:
The ability to edit messages posted by other users.
Normally they users can only edit their own messages.

sect2.title: Delete
sect2.para: The ability to deletes threads & posted by other users.

sect2.title: Sticky posts
sect2.para: The ability to create Sticky/Announcement threads.

sect2.title: Create polls
sect2.para: The ability to add polls to messages posted on the forum.

sect2.title: Votes
sect2.para:
Whether or not the user may vote on the polls in the forum.
This option will ALWAYS be set to NO for anonymous users, since their uniqueness cannot be determined reliably.

sect2.title: Attach files
sect2.para:
Whether or not the user can attach file(s) to their messages.
If the number of allowed file attachments for the forum is set to 0, then even if this option is set to 'Yes' users will not be able to attach files.

sect2.title: Rate threads
sect2.para:
Whether or not a user can rate threads inside the forum.
This option will ALWAYS be set to NO for anonymous users, since their uniqueness cannot be determined reliably.

sect2.title: Lock threads
sect2.para:
The ability to lock & unlock threads in the forum.
Users with this ability will also have the ability to post replies in locked threads.

sect2.title: Move threads
sect2.para: The ability to move or request that a thread be moved to another forum.

sect2.title: Use smilies
sect2.para: If enabled, the user's emoticon tags will be converted to equivalent smiley images during the posting process.

sect2.title: Use image tags
sect2.para:
Whether or not this user may use &fudcode;'s [img] tags in their code.
If the maximum allowed images per message option is set to 0 this option will have no affect.
